antiblooming_state_flag 1.0 img.antiblooming_state_flag false Elizabeth D. Rye The antiblooming_state_flag attribute indicates whether antiblooming was used for this image. Blooming occurs when photons from an individual cell in a CCD array overflow into surrounding cells. Antiblooming measures are used to either prevent or correct for this effect.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None

geometry_projection_type 1.0 img.geometry_projection_type false Jordan Padams The geometry_projection_type attribute specifies the state of the pixels in an image before a re-projection has been applied. Describes if or how the pixels have been reprojected. RAW indicates reprojection has not been done; the pixels are as they came from the camera. Other types are defined by missions.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
raw Indicates the image uses a CAHVOR or one of the CAHVORE camera models.
linearized Indicates reprojection has been performed to linearize the camera model (thus removing things like lens distortion). This means the image uses a CAHV camera model.
linearization_mode 1.0 img.linearization_mode false Jordan Padams The linearization_mode attribute specifies what kind of stereo partner was used to linearize the image (the process requires two camera models).
true ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
nominal The image was linearized using the nominal stereo partner at the same pointing (whether or not the partner image was actually acquired).
actual The image was linearized using an actual stereo partner image, which may be at a different pointing or rover location (e.g. long-baseline or re-pointed stereo). The actual partner product will be referenced by the Stereo_Product_Reference class.
none Linearization has not been performed.
linearization_mode_fov 1.0 img.linearization_mode_fov false Jordan Padams The linearization_mode_fov attribute specifies how the linearized camera model's field of view (FOV) w as constructed (corresponding to the "cahv_fov" parameter in MIPL software).
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
min Indicates the FOV is the intersection of the two cameras, which means some data are cut off and typically stretched horizontally, but there are no black areas.
max Indicates the FOV is the union of the two cameras, which preserves the edges of the images but typically compresses the image horizontally, and creates black areas.
linear Uses only the CAHV vectors, which tends to preserve the aspect ratio and scale of the original but both cuts off data and has black areas.
none Linearization has not been performed.
stereo_baseline 1.0 img.stereo_baseline false Jordan Padams The stereo_baseline attribute specifies the separation between the two cameras used for processing of the stereo image.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_Length

image_id 1.0 img.image_id false Jordan Padams The image_id specifies an image and typically consists of a sequence of characters representing 1) a routinely occurring measure, such as revolution number, 2) a letter identifying the spacecraft, target, or camera, and 3) a representation of a count within the measure, such as picture number within a given revolution. NOTE: See the Imaging FDD for more detailed definition. Examples: Mariner 9 - LevanthalIdentifier - (orbit, camera, pic #, total # of pics in orbit) Viking Orbiter - (orbit #, sc, pic # (FSC/16)) Viking Lander - (sc, camera, mars doy, diode (filter), pic # for that day) Voyager - (pic # for encounter, FDS for cruise)

image_type 1.0 img.image_type false Jordan Padams The image_type attribute specifies the type of image acquired. This may be used to describe characteristics that differentiate one group of images from another such as the nature of the data in the image file, the purpose for which the image was acquired, or the way in which it was acquired. This element is very similar to the older image_observation_type element, but is designed to resolve ambiguities in cases where missions utilize a naming convention for both specific images and more general observations, which consist of multiple images. In those cases, the latter may be described by the observation_type element.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
regular image
ref pixels reference pixels

false All telemetry packets that were expected were received.
1 Some telemetry packets that were expected were not received.
true Some telemetry packets that were expected were not received.
packet_map_mask 0.1 img.packet_map_mask false Elizabeth D. Rye The packet_map_mask attribute is a binary or hexadecimal number identifying which of a data file's expected packets were actually received. The digits correspond positionally with the relative packet numbers of the data file. The bits are to be read left to right; i.e., the first (left-most) digit of the number corresponds to the first packet of the data file. A bit value of 1 indicates that the packet was received; a value of 0 indicates that it was not received.
false ASCII_Numeric_Base16 Units_of_None

data_correction_type 1.0 img.data_correction_type false Jordan Padams The data_correction_type attribute specifies the type of data correction to be applied using the accompanying file.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
brightness The accompanying referenced file contains brightness correction parameters for each input file to the derived product. Brightness correction is defined as a mosaic radiometric seam matching process that is done on top of ordinary radiometric correction. Its intent is to reduce visual seams at the expense of radiometric accuracy.
dark current The accompanying data_correction_file should be used to perform radiometric calibration of the image. The dark current image provides a reference label of the build-up of any charges on the sensor that need to be subtracted from a shuttered image during calibration. Selection of the appropriate dark current image may be based on time, camera, temperature, readout conditions, light flood, gain and offset.
flat field Used to perform radiometric calibration of the image, the flat field image provides a reference label of the sensitivity of the used optics across the field of view. The shuttered image needs to be divided by the flat field image during calibration. Selection of the appropriate flat field image may be based on time, camera, temperature, readout conditions, light flood, gain and offset.
inverse lut Specifies the name of the inverse-lookup-table file used in generating the RDR. NOTE: This keyword only applies if sample_bit_mode_id attribute starts with "LUT", i.e. if an inverse lookup table file was used.
responsivity Specifies the name of the responsivity constants file used in generating the RDR used to correct for distortion due to temperature.
data_correction_subtype 1.0 img.data_correction_subtype false Jordan Padams The data_correction_subtype attribute specifies the specific type of data correction to be applied within the realm of the accompanying data_correction_type.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
radiometric_correction_type 1.0 img.radiometric_correction_type false Jordan Padams The radiometric_correction_type identifies the method used for radiometric correction.
true ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
CHEMRAD Correction done by the ChemCam team
MIPLRAD Correction done by MIPL (flat-field, exposure and temperature only)
NONE No radiometric correction has been performed
radiance_offset 1.0 img.radiance_offset false Jordan Padams The radiance_offset attribute specifies the constant value by which a stored radiance is added. Expressed as an equation as follows: true_radiance_value = radiance_offset + radiance_scaling_factor * stored_radiance value There are 3 types of radiometric corrections: Radiance-calibrated RDRs These "RAD" (and "RAL") RDRs have been scaled to absolute radiance units using either pre-flight radiometric calibration coefficients or calibration coefficients derived from in-flight observations of the calibration target. The units on these files are (W/m^2/sr/nm). Radiance factor-calibrated RDRs These "IOF" (and "IOL") RDRs are unitless but have values in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 (for example, average bright Mars soils exhibit I/F ~ 0.35 at 750 nm and I/F ~ 0.05 at 410 nm). Instrumentally-calibrated RDRs These "CCD" (and "CCL") RDRs have had no radiance scaling applied, so the units on these files are "corrected" DN.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_Spectral_Radiance
radiance_scaling_factor 1.0 img.radiance_scaling_factor false Jordan Padams The radiance_scaling_factor specifies the constant value by which a stored radiance is multiplied. NOTE: Expressed as an equation: true_radiance_value = radiance_offset + radiance_scaling_factor * stored_radiance value There are 3 types of radiometric corrections: Radiance-calibrated RDRs These "RAD" (and "RAL") RDRs have been scaled to absolute radiance units using either pre-flight radiometric calibration coefficients or calibration coefficients derived from in-flight observations of the calibration target. The units on these files are (W/m^2/sr/nm). Radiance factor-calibrated RDRs These "IOF" (and "IOL") RDRs are unitless but have values in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 (for example, average bright Mars soils exhibit I/F ~ 0.35 at 750 nm and I/F ~ 0.05 at 410 nm). Instrumentally-calibrated RDRs These "CCD" (and "CCL") RDRs have had no radiance scaling applied, so the units on these files are "corrected" DN.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_None
horizon_mask_elevation 1.0 img.horizon_mask_elevation false Jordan Padams The horizon_mask_elevation attribute specifies the elevation (in degrees) used as the horizontal cutoff in a mask file that, when applied to another image file, prevents the horizon and sky features in the image from being processed. If this keyword is not present in the product label, no horizon mask was used.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_Angle deg
derived_image_type 1.0 img.derived_image_type false Jordan Padams The derived_image_type attribute specifies how to interpret the pixel values in a derived image RDR (or colloquially, the type of the derived image itself). Valid values vary per mission.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
multi_image_radiance_factor 1.0 img.multi_image_radiance_factor false Jordan Padams The multi_image_radiance_factor attribute specifies for a multi-input image (such as a mosaic), the overall multiplicative factor that was applied to each image as the mosaic was being assembled. Together with the multi_image_radiance_offset attribute, this specifies a simple linear adjustment of the form dn * factor + offset, that can be used for (limited) radiometric seam correction. Each pixel within a given input image receives the same correction. The order of images is as defined in the input list file (generally delivered along with the mosaic) or the input_product_id attribute. Applies to RDRs only, not EDRs. Note:: This correction is applied after radiometric correction, if any, performed on the inputs.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_None
multi_image_radiance_offset 1.0 img.multi_image_radiance_offset false Jordan Padams The multi_image_radiance_offset attribute specifies, for a multi-input image (such as a mosaic), the overall additive offset that was applied to each image as the mosaic was being assembled. Together with the multi_image_radiance_factor attribute, this specifies a simple linear adjustment of the form dn * factor + offset, that can be used for (limited) radiometric seam correction. Each pixel within a given input image receives the same correction. Input values of 0 are not adjusted. The order of images is as defined in the input list file (generally delivered along with the mosaic) or INPUT_PRODUCT_ID. Applies to RDRs only, not EDRs. NOTE: This correction is applied after radiometric correction, if any, performed on the inputs.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_None
source_telemetry_start_time 1.0 img.source_telemetry_start_time false Jordan Padams The source_telemetry_start_time attribute specifies the creation time of the source product from which this product was derived. It is the same as value of the source_telemetry_sclk_start attribute converted to Spacecraft Event Time (SCET).
false ASCII_Date_Time_YMD_UTC yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ Units_of_None
source_telemetry_sclk_start 1.0 img.source_telemetry_sclk_start false Jordan Padams The source_telemetry_sclk_start attribute specifies the value of the spacecraft clock (in seconds) at the creation time of the source product from which this product was derived. This differs from SPACECRAFT_CLOCK_START_COUNT, which is the time the instrument acquired the data.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
pointing_model_name 1.0 img.pointing_model_name false Jordan Padams The pointing_model_name attribute specifies which of several "pointing models" were used to transform the camera model based on updated pointing information. These updates are typically derived from mosaic seam corrections. This keyword and the associated Pointing_Model_Index classes define what the updated pointing information is, providing enough information to re-create the camera model from calibration data. If present, this keyword overrides the default pointing based on telemetry. The special value "NONE" shall be interpreted the same as if the keyword is absent (i.e. the default pointing model should be used). New model names can be created at any time; the models themselves should be described in a mission-specific ancillary file. See also the geom:solution_id attribute within the geom:Camera_Model_Parameters class.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
pointing_model_solution_id 1.0 img.pointing_model_solution_id false Jordan Padams The pointing_model_solution_id attribute specifies the identifier of the pointing correction solution used to derive the model specified via the enclosing Pointing_Correction_Parameters class. This identifier should also appear in the pointing correction file referenced by the Data_Correction_File. If there is only one identifier in the correction file, then pointing_model_solution_id may be omitted. The pointing_model_solution_id attribute may be reused in the context of pointing corrections, although uniqueness is recommended. The pointing correction solution ID namespace is separate from the coordinate system namespace.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
index_name 1.0 img.index_name false Jordan Padams The index_name attribute supplies the formal name for the associated value in a group of related values.
false ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed Units_of_None
index_value_real 1.0 img.index_value_real false Jordan Padams The index_value_real attribute provides the real number value as named by the associated index_id or index_name.
false ASCII_Real Units_of_None

PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_SEGMENTS
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_quantization_type 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_quantization_type Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_quantization_type definitions
PDS3 Keyword inst_cmprs_quantz_type
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_type 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_type Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_type definitions
PDS3 Keyword inst_cmprs_type
Nuance For Cassini, the LOSSY compression scheme was Discrete Cosine Transform, the LOSSLESS compression scheme was RICE, and NOTCOMP meant no compression scheme was used.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_name 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_name Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_name definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_NAME
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_mode 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_mode Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_mode definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_MODE
Nuance For MPF, the modes were assigned to the corresponding inst_cmprs_names as follows: 1 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); HUFFMAN/QUALITY 2 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); HUFFMAN/RATIO 3 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); ARITHMETIC/QUALITY 4 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); ARITHMETIC/RATIO 5 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); HUFFMAN/QUALITY/LCT 6 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); HUFFMAN/RATIO/LCT 7 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); ARITHMETIC/QUALITY/LCT 8 JPEG DISCRETE COSINE TRANSFORM (DCT); ARITHMETIC/RATIO/LCT 9 RICE ADAPTIVE VARIABLE-LENGTH CODING (RICE)
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_color_mode 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_color_mode Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_color_mode definitions
VICAR Keyword INST_CMPRS_COLOR_MODE
Nuance For Insight, the instrument_compression_color_mode attribute specifies the JPEG color subsampling mode.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_rate 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_rate Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_rate definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_RATE
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_ratio 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_ratio Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_ratio definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_RATIO
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_quality 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_quality Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_quality definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_QUALITY
Nuance For MPF, if an odd IMP inst_cmprs_mode was used for on-board compression, the inst_cmprs_quality indicated the desired image quality index. If an odd inst_cmprs_mode was used, this indicates the resultant image quality used to reach the desired on-board compression factor.

PDS3 Keyword ANTIBLOOMING_STATE_FLAG
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_error_pixels 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Parameters.img.instrument_compression_error_pixels Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_compression_error_pixels definitions

PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_SEG_FIRST_LINE
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_first_sample 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_first_sample Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG segment_first_sample definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_SEG_FIRST_LINE_SAMP
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_lines 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_lines Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG segment_lines definitions

0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_samples 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_samples Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG segment_samples definitions

0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_missing_pixels 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_missing_pixels Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG segment_missing_pixels definitions

0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_status 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Instrument_Compression_Segment.img.segment_status Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG segment_status definitions
PDS3 Keyword INST_CMPRS_SEGMENT_STATUS
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Imaging_Instrument_Parameters.img.instrument_mode_id 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Imaging_Instrument_Parameters.img.instrument_mode_id Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG instrument_mode_id definitions
PDS3 Keyword INSTRUMENT_MODE_ID
Nuance For Mars Pathfinder, the PDS3 FRAME_ID keyword was used to represent this value. INSTRUMENT_MODE_ID was later used on all missiongs after MPF.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Packet_Parameters.img.packet_creation_sclk 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Packet_Parameters.img.packet_creation_sclk Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG packet_creation_sclk definitions
PDS3 Keyword PACKET_CREATION_SCLK
Nuance for MPF and M98, this value was stored in the primary telemetry packet header of the first packet of a data file, and was the reference used for requesting the data packets from the TDS (Telemetry Delivery System).
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Packet_Parameters.img.expected_packets 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Packet_Parameters.img.expected_packets Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG expected_packets definitions
PDS3 Keyword EXPECTED_PACKETS
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.dark_current_correction_flag 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.dark_current_correction_flag Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG dark_current_correction_flag definitions
Nuance For Mars Pathfinder, this correction was applied to the image on board the spacecraft, before the image was transmitted to Earth.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.flat_field_correction_flag 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.flat_field_correction_flag Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG flat_field_correction_flag definitions
Nuance For Mars Pathfinder, this correction was applied to the image on board the spacecraft, before the image was transmitted to Earth.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.bad_pixel_replacement_flag 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.bad_pixel_replacement_flag Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG bad_pixel_replacement_flag definitions
Nuance For Mars Pathfinder, if set to TRUE, certain pixels in the image were replaced based on a bad pixel table.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.shutter_effect_correction_flag 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Data_Correction_Parameters.img.shutter_effect_correction_flag Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG shutter_effect_correction_flag definitions
Nuance For Mars Pathfinder, this correction was applied to the image on board the spacecraft, before the image was transmitted to Earth.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Derived_Product_Parameters.img.horizon_mask_elevation 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Derived_Product_Parameters.img.horizon_mask_elevation Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG horizon_mask_elevation definitions
VICAR Keyword HORIZON_MASK_ELEVATION
Nuance For Insight, this is in degrees as measured in the Local Level (or, equivalently, Site) frame.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Derived_Product_Parameters.img.multi_image_radiance_factor 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Derived_Product_Parameters.img.multi_image_radiance_factor Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG multi_image_radiance_factor definitions
PDS3 Keyword MSL:IMAGE_RADIANCE_FACTOR
VICAR Keyword IMAGE_RADIANCE_FACTOR
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Derived_Product_Parameters.img.multi_image_radiance_offset 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Derived_Product_Parameters.img.multi_image_radiance_offset Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG multi_image_radiance_offset definitions
PDS3 Keyword MSL:IMAGE_RADIANCE_OFFSET
VICAR Keyword IMAGE_RADIANCE_OFFSET
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_downlink_protocol_type 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_downlink_protocol_type Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG telemetry_downlink_protocol_type definition
PDS3 Keyword TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE
PDS3 Keyword MSL:TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE
Nuance For MSL, the MSL:TELEMETRY_SOURCE_TYPE element specifies the classification of the source of the telemetry used in creating this data set.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_application_id 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_application_id Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG telemetry_application_id definition
PDS3 Keyword TELEMETRY_FORMAT_ID
Nuance In PDS3, the TELEMETRY_FORMAT_ID element supplies a telemetry format code.
PDS3 Keyword APPLICATION_PROCESS_ID
Nuance In PDS3, the APPLICATION_PROCESS_ID identifies the process, or source, which created the data.
PDS3 Keyword APPLICATION_PACKET_ID
Nuance In PDS3, the application_packet_id element identifies the telemetry packet queue to which the data were directed.
PDS3 Keyword TELEMETRY_APPLICATION_ID
Nuance In PDS3, the TELEMETRY_APPLICATION_ID element is used to link a data product (file) to a given application or structure description, when multiple formats exist within a single telemetry format.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_application_name 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_application_name Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG telemetry_application_name definition
PDS3 Keyword APPLICATION_PROCESS_NAME
Nuance In PDS3, the APPLICATION_PROCESS_NAME element provides the name associated with the source or process which created the data.
PDS3 Keyword APPLICATION_PACKET_NAME
Nuance In PDS3, the application_packet_name element provides the name associated with the telemetry packet queue to which data were directed.
Nuance For Mars Pathfinder, the queues were distinguished on the basis of type and priority of data.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_application_subtype_id 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_application_subtype_id Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG telemetry_application_subtype_id definition
PDS3 Keyword APPLICATION_PROCESS_SUBTYPE_ID
Nuance In PDS3, the APPLICATION_PROCESS_SUBTYPE_ID element identifies the source or subprocess that created the data.
PDS3 Keyword TELEMETRY_FMT_EXTENSION_TYPE
Nuance In PDS3, the TELEMETRY_FMT_EXTENSION_TYPE element provides additional information about what kind of telemetry was collected during scene looks versus calibration looks. Valid values are: LONG (Scene: Long Telemetry, Calibration: Long Telemetry) SHORT (Scene: Short Telemetry, Calibration: Short Telemetry) MIXED (Scene: Short Telemetry, Calibration: Long Telemetry)
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_provider_id 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.telemetry_provider_id Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG telemetry_provider_id definition
PDS3 Keyword TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_ID
Nuance In PDS3, te TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_ID element identifies the provider and or version of the telemetry data used in the generation of this data.
PDS3 Keyword TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_TYPE
Nuance In PDS3, the TELEMETRY_PROVIDER_TYPE element classifies the source of the telemetry used in creation of this data set.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.earth_received_start_date_time 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.earth_received_start_date_time Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG earth_received_start_date_time definition
PDS3 Keyword EARTH_RECEIVED_START_TIME
Nuance In PDS3, the earth_received_start_time element provides the beginning time at which telemetry was received during a time period of interest. This should be represented in UTC system format. See also earth_received_time.
PDS3 Keyword EARTH_RECEIVED_TIME
Nuance In PDS3, the earth_received_time element provides the time at which telemetry was received on earth. This should be represented in the UTC system format. For real time data, the difference between this time and the spacecraft_event_time is the signal travel time from the spacecraft to earth. Formation rule: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.fff]
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.earth_received_stop_date_time 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.earth_received_stop_date_time Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG earth_received_stop_date_time definition
PDS3 Keyword EARTH_RECEIVED_STOP_TIME
Nuance In PDS3, The earth_received_stop_time element provides the ending time for receiving telemetry during a time period of interest. This should be represented in the UTC system format. See also earth_received_time.
0001_NASA_PDS_1.pds.Property_Map.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.surface_gravity 0001_NASA_PDS_1.img.Telemetry_Parameters.img.surface_gravity Attribute xpath to an XML label instance if needed IMG surface_gravity definition
PDS3 Keyword surface_gravity
